SEARCH
Package edu.byu.ece.rapidSmith.bitstreamTools.configurationSpecification

Class DeviceLookup

java.lang.Object
edu.byu.ece.rapidSmith.bitstreamTools.configurationSpecification.DeviceLookup
public class DeviceLookup extends Object
Contains a number of static methods for looking up specific parts from a library and returning the corresponding XilinxConfigurationSpecification object. There are two types of part names: Root Part Name: This refers to a part name that does not have the package information Package Part Name: This refers to a part name that includes the package information

  • Field Details

    • _singleton

      protected static DeviceLookup _singleton

    • _libraries

      protected List<PartLibrary> _libraries

  • Constructor Details

    • DeviceLookup

      protected DeviceLookup()
      This constructor is protected so that only this class can create an instance (so there can only be a single instance of the class ever). The reason for using a singleton instance instead of just a bunch of static methods is that the methods require the use of a list of part libraries. The singleton instance eliminates the need to create the list of part libraries every time one of the static methods is used. This way, the list is created only once (the first time it is needed) and saved for later use.

  • Method Details

    • sharedInstance

      public static DeviceLookup sharedInstance()
      Get (create if necessary) the singleton instance of this class.

    • lookupPartFromPartnameOrBitstreamExitOnError

      public static XilinxConfigurationSpecification lookupPartFromPartnameOrBitstreamExitOnError(String partName, Bitstream bitstream)
      Searches for a configuration specification from first a string and if null it searches for the part from the bitstream. This method will exit if there is an error and is best used in main functions.

    • lookupPartFromPartnameOrBitstreamExitOnError

      public static XilinxConfigurationSpecification lookupPartFromPartnameOrBitstreamExitOnError(Bitstream bitstream)

    • lookupPartFromBitstream

      public static XilinxConfigurationSpecification lookupPartFromBitstream(Bitstream bitstream)
      Performs a part lookup based on the header information in a bitstream. Returns a null if there is no header or if there is no valid match.

    • lookupPartV4V5V6

      public static XilinxConfigurationSpecification lookupPartV4V5V6(String partName)
      Given a root device name, lookup the part within the V4, V5, and V6 part libraries and return the appropriate XilinxConfigurationSpecification. null is returned if a matching part cannot be found.
      Parameters:
      partName - Name of the device.
      Returns:
      The corresponding spec or null if none exists.

    • lookupPartV4V5V6withPackageName

      public static XilinxConfigurationSpecification lookupPartV4V5V6withPackageName(String packageName)
      Given a package device name, return the corresponding XilinxConfigurationSpecification. This will call getRootDeviceName to strip the package and then call lookupPartV4V5V6.
      Returns:
      the corresponding XilinxConfigurationSpecification or null if none exists.

    • getRootDeviceName

      public static String getRootDeviceName(String partName)
      Given a device name with trailing package name (no separator -- this is how the name is found in a bitstream header), return the root device name. This method will work whether or not the argument includes the "XC" at the beginning of the part name (the names from the bitstream header do NOT include the "XC"). The resulting device name WILL have the "XC" prefix whether or not the argument does.
      Parameters:
      partName - Name of the device
      Returns:
      Root name of the device or null if it could not be determined.

    • getPackageName

      public static String getPackageName(String partName)
      Given a device name with trailing package name (no separator -- this is how the name is found in a bitstream header), return the package name. This method will work whether or not the argument includes the "XC" at the beginning of the part name (the names from the bitstream header do NOT include the "XC").
      Parameters:
      partName - Name of the device
      Returns:
      the package string from the part name.

    • printAvailableParts

      public static void printAvailableParts(OutputStream out)
      Print a list of all available parts in the V456 libraries on the given OutputStream.
      Parameters:
      out -

    • getRootDeviceNameProtected

      protected String getRootDeviceNameProtected(String partName)
      Given a device name with trailing package name (no separator -- this is how the name is found in a bitstream header), return the root device name. This method will work whether or not the argument includes the "XC" at the beginning of the part name (the names from the bitstream header do NOT include the "XC"). The resulting device name WILL have the "XC" prefix whether or not the argument does.
      Parameters:
      partName - Name of the device.
      Returns:
      The root name of the device, or null if it could not be determined.

    • getPackageNameProtected

      protected String getPackageNameProtected(String partName)
      Parses a partname that contains both the device and package information. Returns the package information from the name.

    • lookupPartV4V5V6Protected

      protected XilinxConfigurationSpecification lookupPartV4V5V6Protected(String partName)
      Given a root device name, lookup the part within the V4, V5, and V6 part libraries and return the appropriate XilinxConfigurationSpecification. null is returned if a matching part cannot be found.
      Parameters:
      partName - Name of the device
      Returns:
      Corresponding spec or null if none exists.
